adjectives.description: trepidatory (comparative more trepidatory, superlative most trepidatory)

entries.meaning: That trepidates, or that causes trepidations.
examples: Unfortunately, like Guthrie he has never given a formal statement of his principles, and it is therefore up to the reader to ferret out these things for himself â€” always a trepidatory procedure.

entries.meaning: Of an earthquake, having a vertical, up-and-down motion, as opposed to a horizontal, side-to-side motion.
examples: This [earthquake] was felt at Mexico at precisely the same hour, lasting there about one minute and a half, the motion there being undulatory, but at Acapulco trepidatory.
